page.title: 19A VILLAGE INN,HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content:
The Star and Garter in Chelveston is a pre-15th Century village Inn. In the last 4 years it has been renovated to include a restaurant which was formly the cottage next door.
The Inn is said to have two ghosts, an old lady who wanders through the restaurant late at night and a man in a ruffle who moves things around.
The Inn has a friendly relaxed atmosphere where people can enjoy a drink and a chat. The Inn has a darts board and a pool table. Teams for each sport play other loacl pubs.
Most popular meal : Tandori Chicken Most popular drink : Lager & Bitter Most popular short : Whisky Least popular drink : Dark Rum
